title: Companies Flunk Free Speech
sub_head: Although respecting diverse viewpoints is good for business, companies register a dismal performance on a gauge of their tolerance of ideological diversity.
body:
With Elon Musk’s promise to restore free speech on Twitter , Disney employees expressing dismay with its political activism in Florida, and Netflix saying it won’t make content choices based on staffers’ political views, the time is ripe to restore a business culture that respects American freedoms and ideals as well as diverse views among employees, customers, shareholders, and the general public.
But those who value freedom of speech, religious liberty, and free markets can’t expect that random bursts of encouraging news will foster such a culture. This is especially true considering how captive U.S. businesses have become to a left-wing political agenda that many of their employees, customers, and shareholders don’t support, and that many Americans don’t want imposed on them by powerful governments or private actors.
